citation.article-title: Salsuginibacillus halophilus sp. nov., a halophilic bacterium isolated from a soda lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salsuginibacillus halophilus sp. nov.
Salsuginibacillus halophilus (ha.lo.phi′lus. Gr. n. hals salt; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. halophilus salt-loving).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, spore-forming, non-motile rods, 0.5–0.8×2.5–4.5 μm.
After 48 h, colonies on agar medium are 1–2 mm in diameter, round, convex, entire, yellow and semi-transparent.
Growth occurs at 18–50 °C (optimum 37 °C).
Halophilic; grows at 9–30 % (w/v) NaCl.
Can not grow without NaCl; optimal growth at 19 % (w/v) NaCl.
The pH range for growth is 5.0–10.0 (optimum pH 9.0).
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Casein, DNA, Tween 80, starch and aesculin are not hydrolysed; gelatin is clearly hydrolysed.
H2S is produced.
Indole is not detected.
Urease test is positive.
Phenylalanine deaminase-negative.
The following carbohydrates can be used as sole carbon sources: d-glucose, cellobiose, lactose, maltose, sucrose, d-salicin, trehalose, d-mannitol, glycerol, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol and inositol.
d-Ribose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, raffinose, starch, sodium gluconate, d- and l-arabinose, d-xylose, melezitose and inulin are not fermented.
Resistant to chloramphenicol (30 μg per disc), ampicillin (10 μg), tetracycline (30 μg) and carbenicillin (100 μg) and sensitive to streptomycin (10 μg) and kanamycin (30 μg).
Major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
Cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Polar lipids include diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, glycolipid and a phospholipid of unknown structure.
Predominant respiratory quinone is MK-7.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.4 mol%.
The type strain, halo-1T (=CGMCC 1.7653T =NBRC 104934T), was isolated from sediment of Xiarinaoer soda lake in Inner Mongolia, China.
